name: mdserve
description: Fast markdown preview server with live reload and theme support

repo.name: mdserve
repo.description: Fast markdown preview server with live reload and theme support.

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and installation instructions with comprehensive examples, but lacks troubleshooting guidance for common issues.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section - users won't know how to handle common problems like port conflicts, file watching issues, or WebSocket connection failures

injection_risks.description: The markdown_to_html function uses the markdown crate with allow_dangerous_html set to true, which can lead to XSS attacks if user input is not properly sanitized.
The markdown_to_html function uses the markdown crate with frontmatter enabled, which can potentially allow for template injection attacks if user input is not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Potential XSS attack vector through markdown_to_html function
Lack of input validation for file paths and contents
security.summary: The mdserve application has some security concerns, including potential XSS attacks and lack of input validation, but does not appear to expose sensitive information or use insecure defaults.

common_complaints: Image serving from subdirectories not working
sentiment.summary: Small but engaged community with reasonable issue quality; maintainer appears responsive to bugs but some feature requests remain open without updates.

red_flags: Occasional reluctance to consider new features without significant user demand
Tendency to dismiss certain PRs due to dependency concerns
communication.summary: The maintainer is generally clear and patient, but shows some reluctance in adding new features or dependencies without strong community support.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite being last updated over 3 months ago
17 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
No merged PRs or active development in past 6 months
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Last commit is from October 2025, indicating project has stalled
maintenance.summary: mdserve is an abandoned project with no maintenance activity, active development, or issue resolution for at least 6 months.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-categorized and appears comprehensive, but lacks clear marking of breaking changes and migration guides.

project_metrics.description: Fast markdown preview server with live reload and theme support.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides clear and concise information about the package, its features, and installation instructions, but lacks comprehensive troubleshooting documentation.
concerns: Community: lack of responsiveness to issues
Communication: Occasional reluctance to consider new features without significant user demand
Communication: Tendency to dismiss certain PRs due to dependency concerns
Security: Potential XSS attack vector through markdown_to_html function
Security: Lack of input validation for file paths and contents
Security: The markdown_to_html function uses the markdown crate with allow_dangerous_html set to true, which can lead to XSS attacks if user input is not properly sanitized.
High bus factor risk (89% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent commits and releases within the past month
Multiple contributors active in the last six months
A healthy ratio of merged PRs to open PRs
